intro: Coussapoa viridifolia, commonly known as the green-leaved tree, is a species of flowering plant in the Malvaceae family. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in tropical rainforest environments. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped, dark green leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. It produces woody capsules as fruits, which contain numerous seeds. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
